actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relative to freedom from forced assignment to schools or jobs because of race, creed, or color.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides that no public school student shall, because of his race, creed, or color, be assigned to or required to attend a particular school. Provides that no public school teacher or other public employee of the United States or of the several States or any political subdivision thereof shall, because of his race, creed, or color, be employed, promoted, or assigned to or required to work at any particular job or location.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relative to freedom from forced assignment to schools or jobs because of race, creed, or color.
